text: Fallen snow blankets the sprawling retreat in white. ARME MEN carrying MP-5s patrol the wooded footpaths.
In the distance, the HIGH WHINE of engines. Four SNOWMOBILES race through the drifted fields. Slalomi between the naked trees.

The lead Sno-Cat STREAKS forward. Slews to a stop at the edge of Camp David’s broad, frozen lake. The rider turns Meet MIKE BANNING. Good-looking, 30s, build of a former college athlete. Wearing the unmistakable shades and coil earpiece of the United States Secret Service. The other Sno-Cats pull up under Banning’s watchful gaze. The riders are -- BENJAMIN ASHER, a robust 50, President the United States -- MARTIN TRUMBULL, 53, the Southern-br Speaker of the House -- and MARGARET “MAGGIE” ASHER, the First Lady, a striking 42. Riding tandem with the Preside is his 6-year-old son, CONNOR.
Impressive riding, Agent Banning --
Just leading the way, sir.
(inhales the crisp air) We need to do this more often -- Maggie removes her helmet, smiles.
Don’t you believe him, Mike. Barely got him out here today -- it’s all work with this one. Maggie smooths stray hairs away from her face, tucks them under her knit cap.

(to Connor) How ya holdin’ up back there, partner? You an ice cube yet? Connor, face nearly blue, bravely shakes his head no. Banning reaches out, tweaks the visor of the boy’s helmet Connor beams back... hero-worship personified.
(to Asher, only half- joking) Can’t be any colder than the reception your foreign policy initiative’s gettin’ on the Hill, Mr. President.
It’s the will of the people, Marty. That’s what matters --
Maggie’s right, Marty. Ask anyone -- (turns to Banning) Where do you stand on my platform, Mike? Off the record, of course.
Oh, I try’n leave politics to those who know it best, Mr. President. You know, the professionals... He casts a sideways look at Trumbull. Maggie laughs.

Dodged like a true politician -- (she puts her helmet back on) Well, I don’t know about the rest of you -- but I say last one across the lake makes the hot chocolate -- Banning’s eyes shift to Asher, who nods. Banning raises h wrist mic.
Mustang -- this is Bigtop -- over.
Two men cradling MP-5s, AGENTS ROMA and O’NEIL, stand on frozen shoreline.
(into wrist mic) Mustang here.
(filtered) Bringing home full package from Blue- Six -- repeat Blue-Six -- over. Roma raises his Steiner Marine tactical binoculars. POV ROMA: The snowmobiles idle on the far side of the lak
Copy that, Bigtop. Have you on visual --
Banning turns to the others.
Everyone ready? Heads bob. Banning REVS his throttle -- and TAKES OFF.
The agents track them through their binoculars. POV O’NEIL: The Sno-Cats TEAR ASS across the frozen lake, four abreast. Banning leads the way. O’ NEIL (shakes his head) Always the cowboy --
The snowmobiles ZOOM across the ice. Engines whining, nearly halfway home when
The First Lady’s engine COUGHS.  The other snowmobiles streak ahead, racing for shore. Maggie’s engine DIES, sputtering machine skidding to a st

Banning and the others power up onto the bank. Roma and O’Neil sprint down the shoreline, pointing. Banning whirls. And sees -- MAGGIE’S SNO-CAT out on the ice. The color drains from Banning’s face. Roma and O’Neil rush up. O’ NEIL Jesus, what the --
The ice begins to SPLINTER, cracking. Maggie’s eyes are frantic, heavy machine breaking through.
Banning leaps from his Sno-Cat. Sprints across the ice.
Get off it! Get off the sled!
Maggie’s snowsuit pant loop SNAGS on the machine. She jer her leg, panicked, trying to get free. The ice fissures WIDEN. Banning races forward, stripping off his parka.
Get off it now!
The ice CAVES IN, sucking Maggie and the Sno-Cat under.
(horrified) Maggie! Asher lunges for his wife. Roma restrains him.
Sir, no -- ! Asher jerks free and TAKES OFF RUNNING, out onto the ice. Roma and O’Neil give chase. O’ NEIL (into wrist mic) Rosebud is down! Rosebud is down! POTUS is on the ice!
Maggie pounds against the ice, eyes wide with terror.
Roma and O’Neil chase after Asher. Alarm klaxons WAIL alo the shoreline as
races forward at a DEAD RUN. Sprinting all out. He reache the jagged hole in the ice and
into the freezing water.
Silent, cold, dark. Banning swims down. Eyes darting, desperately searching. And in the dimness below...

stares up at him, hair streaming behind her. Floating awa into the frozen depths. Banning struggles down to her. Face contorted in pain. He’s out of air.  He keeps diving. A superhuman effort. His hand reaches out and GRABS MAGGIE’S ARM Banning pulls her toward the surface. Dim light flickerin through the frozen ice above. He reaches for his shoulder holster and
Banning aims the gun straight up. What is he doing -- ?

Gun blasts blow a GAPING HOLE in the frozen ice. Banning BURSTS from below. Roma and O’Neil race up. Pull Maggie from the frigid water. They lay her on the ice. Eyes rolled back, unmoving. O0/’ desperately administers CPR.
No, God! No! Asher drops to his knees. Nearly delirious with disbelief and fear. O’Neil frantically tries to revive her. Banning can only stare, trembling in the bitter cold.

Mom? Banning turns. Connor stares at him, lower lip quivering. The boy’s face frozen in a rictus of horror. Asher grabs his son in his arms. The President and Bannin lock eyes. Banning lowers his gaze. As overhead, the POUNDING ROTORS of the descending RESCUE CHOPPER whirl...
CLOSE ON: A spinning RAZOR SCOOTER WHEEL.
Wearing a crash helmet, Connor, now 8, zooms through the halls of the White House on his Razor Scooter.

POV MOVING FAST -- Ducking and darting with practiced ski Connor expertly weaves through the corridors and passagew of the Ground Floor. The kid obviously knows the Executive Mansion cold. Connor speeds down the Center Hall, past a RECEPTIONIST a her desk. Busy on the phone, she smiles at Connor as he passes. Connor waves back. Connor zooms into the WHITE HOUSE KITCHEN.
An unsmiling PASTRY CHEF meticulously ices a tray of PETI FOURS. The LOCAL NEWS plays on a small counter TV.
-- with highs today pushing 100 in what promises to be a real scorcher of a July Fourth for the entire greater D.C. area -- Connor speeds past -- hand furtively reaching for a mini- éclair --
(French accent) Connor! Pas encore! The boy jerks his hand back, keeps going.
(calling back over his shoulder) Je suis désolé! Connor zooms from the kitchen.
Connor ducks and weaves down the corridor. As up ahead, through an open door we see...

Banks of MONITORS manned by keen-eyed TECHNICIANS. Standing by the door, the HEAD TECHNICIAN pulls the last CHOCOLATE CHIP MUFFIN from a white box and sets it ona napkin. The LOCAL NEWS, playing on a small monitor screen grabs his attention. ON MONITOR SCREEN: NEWS FOOTAGE of North Korean ARMED FOR massing along the DMZ. The banner headline reads: “NORTH KOREAN BUILDUP CONTINUES TO SPARK FEARS”.

-- ongoing massive North Korean war games along the 38th Parallel continue to send shock waves throughout South Korea, prompting this morning’s emergency meeting between President Asher and South Korean Foreign Minister Lee Tae- Woo -- The head technician turns for his muffin... it’s gone.
Connor zooms down the corridor. Takes a BIG BITE of the chocolate chip muffin.
Carver Langston section of town. Tired-looking brick rowhomes line the street. The dome of the Capitol rises distantly in the morning haze.

A dim bedroom. The battered window air conditioner RATTLE water steadily dripping into the almost-full BUCKET under A phone on the nightstand RINGS, JARRING. Keeps RINGING.  A HAND slowly reaches from beneath the covers. Picks up.
(groggy) Yeah?
Did I wake you? Banning sits up. Rubs a hand across his tired face.
No. He reaches for the remote and flicks on the TV. The local news plays, low.
Gonna make it over for dinner Sunday?
(beat) Uh -- I don’t know yet -- Banning’s eyes flick to the TV. BANNING (cont’ d) -- let me think about it -- An awkward silence on the line.
-- Seoul continues to be in a state of crisis following the sweeping U.S. troop withdrawals central to the Asher administration’s increasingly controversial foreign policy platform --
(hesitant) I saw Kristen yesterday...
Yeah? ON TV: Asher addresses the media from the White House Ros Garden. Flanked by his SECRET SERVICE protection detail.  10.
I appreciate my critics’ position. But this administration marks the end of America’s decades-long pattern of global intervention --
.»..she got engaged... A flicker of emotion crosses Banning’s face.
(covering) Good for her.
-- the United States will no longer be the world’s policeman. Banning’s eyes stay fixed on the TV.
I just... I didn’t want you to hear it from someone else -- ON TV: The Secret Service briskly escorts Asher from the podium.

I gotta get to work -- He hangs up. Clicks off the TV. The water from the air conditioner continues to DRIP. Banning gets out of bed, absently pushes aside the overfl bucket with his foot. Slides a dented WASTEBASKET over to take its place. Shoulders slumped, he pads into the bathroom.

Banning exits, wearing the white short-sleeved uniform sh black pants, and gold badge of the Secret Service UNIFORM DIVISION. He looks one step up from a Rent-A-Cop. He slides into his beat-up Dodge Ram pickup and pulls fro the curb.  11.

Chanting PROTESTERS march outside the gate, waving signs reading “IMPEACH ASHER!”, “DON’T LEAVE SOUTH KOREA DEFENSELESS!”, “FREEDOM THROUGH STRENGTH!”, etc. The WHITE HOUSE itself rises majestically from the emeral South Lawn. Secret Service SNIPERS on the roof, K-9 PATRO circling the grounds, armed GUARDS at every entrance. The most protected building on earth.

President Asher holds a tense meeting with his inner circ Including Speaker of the House Trumbull, they are: 1) LUIS CARDOZA, Hispanic, the Vice President 2) RUTH McMILLAN, tough, unsmiling, the Secretary of Defe 3) ADMIRAL NATHAN HOENIG, bald, Chairman of the Joint Chi
Lee’s gonna want you to reconsider, Mr. President.
Nate, you know damn well it’s the nukes of the Seventh Fleet keeping the peace over there, not our boots on the ground --
But those troops served as the trip wire, sir. And the South Koreans know that.
That’s why the Fleet stays. Cardoza rallies behind the President.
And the three billion saved from this move alone will fund over 100 new schools, not to mention --  12.
(cuts him off) South Korea doesn’t give a shit about any of that -- they’ve got the whole goddamn North Korean Army ready to pour across their border!
That’s not going to happen.
Can you guarantee that? Asher sighs, rubs his eyes.
Marty, you've been awfully quiet --
Minister Lee knows we’1ll stand by him, Mr. President. He needs reassurance, that’s all. (beat) Give it to him.

A private airstrip in the middle of nowhere. An unmarked C-130 CARGO PLANE idles on the grassy runway. Four Allison T56 turboprops THROBBING. Two buzzcut, military-looking NORTH KOREANS in flight sui race up the rear ramp, pulling on flight helmets. With a mechanical WHINE, the ramp door closes.
The North Korean PILOT and CO-PILOT finish their pre-flig
(in Korean, subtitled) Wheels up. He throws the throttle forward.

The lumbering plane ROARS down the runway, and lifts into cloudless blue sky. And we see...  13. Eerily, left behind on the airstrip, a SMALL TABLE covere a white tablecloth. Bottle of soju (Korean distilled alcohol) and four ceremonial cups atop it. The tablecloth flutters gently in the breeze.
An anonymous, 9-story tan brick building on H Street.

Dispiritedly sipping coffee, Banning checks IDs inside th main entrance. His face is rote, expressionless. It’s soul-crushingly boring, but hey, at least the A/C’s crank A fellow officer, HUTCHINS, 30s, strides up.
Banning -- Lieutenant says there’s a problem in Sector 14. Water Authority has to check it out -- Banning takes a final gulp of coffee, stands.
(resigned) I’m on it -- He heads for the door. Hutchins takes over his post.
(sarcastic) Stay cool.
Connor brakes to a SKIDDING STOP on his scooter at the en a long corridor. At the far end of the hall, he sees his father and the others exit the Cabinet Room.
Meeting adjourned, Asher pulls Trumbull aside.  14.
Thanks for sitting in, Marty. I want you to know your support has been invaluable.
(nods) Just tell me something, Ben -- Asher waits, expectant. TRUMBULL (cont’d) Are you sure about all this?
I made a promise to the people. And I intend to keep it. Trumbull shakes Asher’s hand.
Have a good meeting with the Minister.
I will. And you have a Happy 4th. Trumbull smiles, exits through a side door. Asher turns a disappears back into the Cabinet Room -- not seeing his s at the far end of the hall.
Who watches his father go. Face unreadable.
The Head Technician peers at a closed-circuit monitor. CLOSE ON MONITOR: The South Korean motorcade pulls beneat the North Portico.
Our guests have arrived.
Trumbull exits through the Pennsylvania Avenue guardhouse Glances at the arriving motorcade as he slides into his waiting Town Car.  15.

The doors of the motorcade open, and South Korean Foreign Minister LEE TAE-WOO, 50s, dignified, emerges behind a phalanx of BODYGUARDS. An impeccably dressed MAN in wire-rimmed glasses, mid 30s steps out behind Lee. Unassuming, reserved accountant’s demeanor, but eyes missing nothing. This is KANG.
Agent Roma (recognizable from the Camp David opening) -- Special Agent In Charge of the White House Secret Service detail -- greets Lee at the door.
Foreign Minister Lee -- I’m Special Agent in Charge Roma. Welcome to the White House.

Thank you, Agent Roma. May I introduce my head of security and chief aide, Mr. Kang -- Kang bows, formal. Roma nods back. Only Lee, Kang, and the Minister’s personal security deta PAK, LIM (female), CHO and YU -- are permitted inside. Al surrender their weapons to the Secret Service. Roma scrutinizes Lee’s delegation as they pass through th White House MILLIMETER-WAVE SCANNER. Each guest walks through the large portal -- 9 feet tall 6 feet wide -- pauses and lifts their arms while the mach takes TWO FULL-BODY SCANS using radio waves. A male TECHNICIAN watches the black-and-white images on h computer screen. [NOTE: The images are detailed enough to see the sweat on a person’s back.] Lim (wearing a trim blue suit, strand of pearls) hesitate before entering the machine. She shoots Roma a look, pointed.  16. Roma nods, and a FEMALE TECHNICIAN sits down to review Li screen image.

The South Korean motorcade exits the drive, and parks alo the protected stretch of Pennsylvania Avenue in front of White House. DIPLOMATIC SECURITY (DS) AGENTS establish a secure perimeter around the vehicles.
The pilot and co-pilot stare straight ahead, faces expressionless. POV THROUGH WINDSCREEN: In the far distance, the city of Washington D.C. rises in the morning haze.

A thousand yards across the Mall from the White House, a SERVICE RANGER stands outside a cordoned area on the bank the Tidal Basin. Behind the yellow caution tape, WORKERS erect firing platforms for this evening’s holiday firewor display. Banning pulls up in a white Secret Service SUV. The Range waves him through. Banning parks the vehicle, gets out, a crosses to a pair of D.C. Water and Sewer workmen (TATE, ORTIZ) standing over a manhole.
Hey guys, what’s up?
Fireworks techs say they’re getting steam venting all up and down the line --
Not surprised -- most of the pipes under here gotta be almost 80 years old -- Banning wipes the sweat from his face, humidity hanging l a shroud.  17.
(jerks a thumb) Well, see that? That’s 20,000 pounds of pyrotechnic explosive, Cochise. Let’s just say it’s makin’ ‘em nervous.
Can’t say I blame ‘em. Ortiz gestures to the closed manhole cover.
Tried liftin’ that sucker myself, but the bitch won’t budge -- Banning conjures a MASTER KEY from his belt key chain.
Need the keys to the kingdom. Banning unlocks the manhole cover and lifts.
You go, Sixto.
Why me?
Dude, I went last time -- Ortiz scowls, grabs his toolbox. Banning follows him down the ladder.
...puta madre.
Ortiz’s flashlight plays over the twisting maze of pipes. Steam HISSES ominously in the darkness.
Vacuum breakers are shot. Foulin’ up all the feeds... Banning trails Ortiz down the dark tunnel. His face twist the stench down here is overpowering.  18.
Jesus --
You're tellin’ me -- (continues on) -- holiday pay’s not enough for this shit --
President Asher moves down the hall with Cardoza, McMilla and Hoenig. Pushes open an inner door, and steps into...
The Oval Office. Foreign Minister Lee stands. As does the rest of Asher’s entire assembled NATIONAL SECURITY TEAM.
Minister Lee, it’s good to see you again.
Thank you, Mr. President. I appreciate you taking the time to meet on your nation’s holiday.
Shall we sit?

In the corridor outside, Roma stands across from Kang. Th two professionals share an amicable look. Roma moves closer, admires the LAPEL PIN embossed with th South Korean flag affixed to Kang’s suit. It’s round, slightly larger than the American flag pin on Roma’s own lapel.
Snazzy --
Thank you, Agent Roma.  19. Kang bows again, polite. When suddenly
zooms around the corner on his Razor Scooter. He BRAKES t stop, just short of the two security men.
(to Roma) Can I see my dad?
Sorry, he’s in a meeting.
A long one? Roma shrugs, sympathetic. Connor’s eyes shift to Kang. Kang imperceptibly nods back
Banning restlessly fidgets while Ortiz works.
So who’d you piss off, anyway?
What?

Hadda do something -- to be the one sent down here -- Banning shrugs, noncommittal. ORTIZ (cont’d) -- thought you guys all flew around on Air Force One and shit -- Behind them, a low stealthy rustling. Ortiz swings his li down the tunnel and
crouches in the darkness. Eyes reflecting back red.
Freakin’ Willard, man!  20.
You ain’t kiddin’ --

Hey -- wanna see somethin’ ? Ortiz pulls a piece of BEEF JERKY from his pocket, tosses down the pipe. The rat crawls forward, nose twitching. ORTIZ (cont’d) C’mon, you ugly mother -- The rat crawls closer. Ortiz leans forward, face expectan ORTIZ (cont’d) Hear that? A telltale HISS emits from a recessed vent. The huge rat waddles forward when suddenly
ERUPTS from the wall vent -- nearly fricasseeing the rat. scampers away into the darkness, squealing.
(cackling) Take that, you lice-covered freak! Ortiz turns back to Banning. ORTIZ (cont’d) (eager) Wanna fry another one? Banning’s look says it all.
The C-130 cargo plane arrows toward Washington.
(filtered) Unidentified aircraft, heading six- zero-niner, this is PPD Command. Be advised, you have entered restricted airspace --  21.
The RADAR OPERATOR stares into her glowing screen.
Repeat, unidentified aircraft, you have strayed into restricted airspace. This is a no-fly zone. You must divert immediately --
The C-130 continues toward the heart of Washington.
Roma bursts into Asher’s meeting.
Mr. President, we have an airspace incursion, sir.
Two F-22 Raptor FIGHTER-INTERCEPTORS streak in. Take up flanking positions alongside the lumbering C-130.
The Raptor PILOT peers through his canopy bubble.

Unidentified flight, Echo-Victor- Foxtrot, this is flight leader U.S. Navy aircraft on your starboard wing. You have entered restricted airspace. You are to divert immediately, vector heading zero-two-zero. Acknowledge. No response. PILOT (cont’d) Unidentified flight, you must divert immediately to vector zero- two-zero. This is your final warning. Acknowledge.  22. The pilot flips a switch, ARMING the F-22’s weapons syste
Without warning, the C-130’s SIDE DOORS simultaneously WH OPEN, revealing --
of two M61 VULCAN ROTARY CANNONS.
The pilot’s face goes white.
Fuck -- He jerks his stick.
Too late. The twin guns OPEN FIRE WITH A BUZZSAW ROAR. Bo F-22s are instantly BLOWN OUT OF THE SKY.
Roma’s earpiece crackles.
(filtered) Code Halo! Repeat, Code Halo! The Secret Service leaps into action. Four agents literal pick up President Asher, rush him from the Oval Office.
The agents race Asher down the corridor.
Dad!
Connor -- it’s okay --  23. Roma grabs Connor. Carrying the boy, he follows the President, the National Security Team, and Lee’s delegati down the hall.
Alarm klaxons WAILING, the White House evacuates. Skeleto holiday staff racing for the exits. Roma herds President Asher’s group inside the EMERGENCY ELEVATOR. Hands Connor off to a TALL AGENT.
Take him! The Tall Agent nods. The heavy steel doors CLOSE. Roma stays behind, weapon drawn. Rushes back down the corridor
A final scrambled F-22 SCREAMS down the runway, into the
The cargo plane passes low over Roosevelt Island. The C-130’s modified CARGO BAY DOORS suddenly open with a mechanical WHINE and
lowers from the plane. Smooth, round, 3 meters across. Ma of white polycarbonate. It looks like a smaller version o the radar housing on the back of an AWACS plane.
D.C. POLICE on the street draw their weapons -- rooftop SNIPERS peer through their scopes -- MARINES atop buildin swing Stinger missiles to their shoulders. Locked. Loaded. Ready.
The emergency elevator doors open. The Secret Service rus Asher and the others down the long corridor.
Go! Go! Go!
Ortiz’s radio squawks.
(filtered) Ortiz! Get the hell up here! Ortiz scrambles for the manhole ladder. Banning follows.
The C-130 pilot speaks into his mic.
(in Korean, subtitled) Goggles down. The pilot, co-pilot, and door gunners flip down protectiv visors.
Ortiz vaults from the open manhole. Tate points to the sky, hand shaking. Ortiz spins and see
skim low over the Lincoln Memorial. Barely clearing the monument’s roof.
What the -- The Park Ranger comes running, gun pointed skyward.  25.
PEDESTRIANS stare up in fear and dismay. TOURISTS on the Mall snap pictures, run for cover. The defenders ready to OPEN FIRE. They’re going to blow t plane out of the fucking sky when --
hanging from the C-130’s underbelly suddenly SCREAMS TO L fires a massive LIGHT PULSE. The invisible pulse radiates every direction -- like an EMP burst --
Everyone on the ground is INSTANTLY BLINDED. Cameras, rad laser targeting systems, all are incapacitated. POV ORTIZ: He stares up at the plane -- AND HIS WHOLE WOR
The Park Ranger and other blinded defenders FIRE WILDLY. Able only to HEAR their target passing overhead. Two Stingers SCREAM from their launchers but miss their mark.

ROARS down the National Mall, over the Reflecting Pool. Straight for the Capitol. The cargo plane takes MULTIPLE HITS, but doesn’t slow. Do gunners POURING FIRE with their Vulcans on the blinded defenders below.
Helpless defenders are BLOWN OFF rooftops, RIDDLED on the street. Crumpling to the ground like broken dolls.
leaps from the open manhole. Sees the Park Ranger, Tate a Ortiz, all clutching their eyes. He draws his Sig Sauer P229. RAPID-FIRES at the lumbering plane above.
A hail of INCENDIARY SLUGS digs across the turf. The Rang and both workmen are CUT TO PIECES. Banning dives away, rolling as
is raked by gunfire. It EXPLODES -- whole truck somersaul into the air -- CRASHING to earth, flames spewing -- The cargo plane suddenly BANKS overhead... Headed directly for the White House.
The C-130 comes in low, over the Ellipse. Uniformed Divis SECRET SERVICE rush from the White House, firing.
fires another LIGHT PULSE. Incapacitating everyone.
Banning’s face twists, blinded.

On the White House roof, the massive Avenger antiaircraft missile pods swivel. Computerized targeting useless. The SECRET SERVICE GUNNER aims blindly. He thumbs the firing button. WHOOSH! The SAM missiles scream from their tubes -- One missile BLASTS THE CARGO PLANE’S TAIL RUDDER IN HALF! The others all miss.

BLAZE AWAY on their Vulcans. The Avenger is OBLITERATED. SECRET SERVICE SNIPERS on the roof -- D.C. POLICE and MAR GUARDS on the South Lawn -- open up blindly with everythi they have. Glocks, MP-5s, M-4 rifles -- All are mowed down.  27.
The final scrambled F-22 fighter SCREAMS IN LOW over the Potomac. Afterburners hot.
The F-22 PILOT thumbs his mic.
PPD Command, this is Wolfhound 6 -- have bogey in sight --
(filtered) Wolfhound 6, fire at will, repeat, fire at will. The pilot gets missile lock. Finger on the firing button.
The rotodome SCREAMS TO LIFE. Fires a final LIGHT PULSE.

POV PILOT: EVERYTHING GOES STARK WHITE. Targeting systems knocked out. Valiant, he blindly unleashes his air-to-air Sidewinder missiles. 20mm cannon BELCHING FLAME. Three of the four Sidewinders DETONATE into the side of t Washington Monument. The fourth SCREAMS past, barely miss by a foot. The F-22 SLAMS straight into the obelisk, BLOWING THE MAS MONUMENT IN HALF. The top half CRASHES TO THE GROUND.
ROARS over the Ellipse. Path clear to the White House whe
SLAMS into the C-130 cockpit. The cargo plane EXPLODES, crashing to earth in a SPECTACULAR FIREBALL mere yards sh of the White House South Lawn.  28.
Asher’s group arrives at the President’s Emergency Operat Center (PEOC) bunker. The nineteen-inch-thick titanium do opens. The Tall Agent’s earpiece buzzes.
(filtered) All units, this is Command. Bogey is down. Repeat, bogey is down.
Command, this is Watchtower One. Confirm that last. A long beat.
Watchtower One. Confirm received. Bogey destroyed. Everyone can finally breathe. The agent releases Connor.

Fallen BODIES lie everywhere. The White House outer defen have been DECIMATED by the attack. Surviving defenders though disoriented, slowly regaining their sight. But the Executive Mansion still stands.
Banning gets to his feet, blinking.

Suddenly, the doors of the South Korean motorcade BURST O Black-clad COMMANDOS in full body armor leap out. RIDDLE surprised DS agents in the street. Rocket-propelled grenades EXPLODE, blowing gaping holes i the White House fence. The South Korean SUVs jump the sidewalk, PLOWING through the fence onto the North Lawn. Secret Service rockets EXPLODE harmlessly off the SUVs’ armor-plated sides.  29. Smoke grenades are RAPID-FIRED, obscuring everything in billowing CLOUDS OF GRAY. The commandos stream across the lawn, thermal-imaging goggles over their masks. POV COMMANDOS: The heat signatures of the White House defenders glow ORANGE-RED in the haze. Secret Service and D.C. Police are CUT DOWN where they st
The Tall Agent’s earpiece erupts in frantic, static-ridde crosstalk.
(filtered) They’ re swarming my sector! Shit, they’ re everywhere... !

What’s going on?! Down the hall, Lim’s hand slips behind her neck. Unclasps her STRAND OF PEARLS. With a glance to Kang, she leans around the corner. Flick her wrist, and the small spheres FLY from the strand. Bou down the hall, rolling among the President’s men. ASHER (cont’d) Connor! Where’s Conn--

The flash-bang grenades EXPLODE. A blinding, incapacitati blast. Kang’s security men burst from around the corner. Whip of their round LAPEL PINS. Razor sharp spring-loaded BLADES flick out. SHURIKEN. The throwing stars whistle. Secret Service agents drop as pole-axed. Kang plants his shuriken between the Tall Agen eyes. Connor spins and runs. Kang sees him disappear around the corner. Kang shoots Yu a look. Yu rushes after the boy.  30.

SUVs ROAR across the lawn, slewing before the North Porti A commando leaps out, shoulders a LAW anti-tank missile. He FIRES. The steel White House doors disappear in a SEARING BLAST. An SUV CRASHES through the gaping hole, whole truck just PLOWING STRAIGHT INTO THE ENTRANCE HALL of the Executive Mansion. Commandos leap into the breach. Roma rallies the defenders. The Secret Service RETURN FIR from the grand staircase of the nation’s most famous home A furious, pitched battle inside the White House.

Kang and his team grab the Secret Service weapons, herd President Asher, Minister Lee, and the entire National Security Team (eleven hostages total) inside the PEOC. INT. PRESIDENT’S EMERGENCY OPERATIONS CENTER (PEOC) -

A large, well-lit room. Hermetically-sealed, waterproof, soundproof, direct-hit-from-a-nuclear-bombproof. A massiv WALLSCREEN and COMPUTER CONSOLE dominates everything. The disoriented hostages are hustled inside. Hands quickl and expertly zipcuffed. Lim sits before the computer console, fingers flying.
Warning lights blink, monitor screens locking.
We’re being shut down! A commando barges in, BLOWING EVERYONE AWAY.  31.

Sight slowly returning, Banning watches helplessly as the smoke swirls and gunfire ECHOES. Face a mask of anguish, battles the suicidal urge to rush blindly into the fray. Working quickly, Banning reloads his weapon. Spins and descends into the open manhole.
Banning clicks his flashlight ON. The beam flickers into darkness ahead. Moving fast, Banning disappears down the pitch black tunn
Connor flees. Races around the corner, almost falling. Ducks into the laundry room. Yu rapidly closes.

Gunshots ECHOING, the battle descends into the bowels of White House. The Secret Service, outmanned and outgunned, fight a hopeless rear guard action. There is no escape. Roma and the last few agents are SHOT LIKE DOGS in the lo basement hallway.

Yu enters the large industrial laundry room. Huge commerc WASHER/DRYERS line the wall. A half dozen rolling LINEN CARTS. Yu violently UPENDS the carts. RIPS OPEN the washer/dryer doors, moving down the line. The kid’s just... gone. Yu slams the wall in frustration. Exits the laundry room.  32.

Banning arrives at a terminus of water mains. A series of encrusted circular hatches, shoulder high. He looks up, orienting himself to the ground above. Quick he moves to the far pipe. Pries at the corroded valve -- thick with decades of rust and slime. It finally opens wi a rending SQUEAL. Banning peers inside. A long, long pipe. Barely three feet wide, pitch black. A claustrophobe’s nightmare. Banning hoists himself up, squeezing in. Crawls forward i the darkness.
Mortally wounded, Roma lies crumpled against the wall. Weakly, he calls into his wrist mic.
Olympus Has Fallen...
Secret Service Command receives the halting transmission.
Roma coughs, spitting blood.
...Olympus Has Fallen. A commando looms over him, razored throwing star in hand. Roma looks up. The shuriken flashes down.
The Command Post RADIOMAN blinks in stunned disbelief.  33.
(face white) They’ ve taken the White House.
A nightmare tableaux of unfathomable devastation. The Washington Monument is a BROKEN RUIN. Fallen Secret Service and Marine guards LITTER the White House grounds. Drifting smoke casts an EERIE PALL.
And impossibly, on the White House roof, a commando RIPS Stars and Stripes from its lanyard -- And throws it to the ground.
Banning crawls forward. Face blackened, filthy. He peers into the darkness ahead and

bars his way. The polished metal gleams, wildly incongruo in the ancient corroded pipe. Banning scrapes away at the grime-encrusted wall -- revea an ELECTRO-MECHANICAL HIGH-SECURITY LOCK. Working quickly he pulls the MASTER KEY from his belt key chain. Inserts key and turns -- A green LED illuminates -- and a recessed wall panel SLID BACK -- revealing a glowing digital CONTROL PANEL. Bannin punches a numeric code into the keypad.
Authenticate.
Echelon 4.
Designator.  34.

Oscar-Zulu, three-zero-niner. The silver flood-hatch IRISES OPEN. A brightly-lit STAINLESS STEEL AQUEDUCT unfolds before hi Shining, pristine. Like some kind of futuristic tube to t underworld. Banning quickly crawls forward.
Lim looks up at Kang from the computer console.
Control override complete. White House systems secured. All outside networks locked out.
Banning crawls forward when suddenly -- ALL THE LIGHTS GO Pitch blackness. He blinks in the darkness when
MOTION DETECTOR BEAMS appear, crisscrossing the tube ahea At two-foot intervals for the next fifteen yards. There’s no way past.
Shit --

Commandos from the upstairs ground assault enter the PEOC Deliver to Kang a STAINLESS STEEL BRIEFCASE. Yu returns to the bunker. He crosses to Kang, whispers lo in his ear. Kang slowly removes his glasses, meticulously folds them. Then -- quick as a cobra -- he spins on Yu and instantly SNAPS HIS NECK.  35. The hostages SCREAM. Kang coolly turns to Pak. A muscular automaton.
Get the boy. Asher leaps to his feet.
Stay away from my son! Kang turns to Asher, face serenely calm.

You’re in no position to demand anything. A commando levels his weapon at Asher’s chest. KANG (cont’d) Sit down. Beat. The President reluctantly sits. Kang turns away, nods to Pak. Pak exits. The bunker SEALS SHUT behind him.
Banning is stymied by the motion detector beams barring h path. He can’t move forward -- Then, faraway, a distant sound. Quickly, it grows LOUDER. Coming closer now, like a runaway train --
Banning’s eyes grow wide as
CRASHES toward him through the pipe. Banning sucks in short, rapid breaths. Urgently filling h lungs as
engulfs him. His gun and flashlight are torn from his gra  36. Banning hangs on against the enormous pressure. Straining lungs screaming for air when
Banning GASPS for breath. Frantic, he rapidly drags himse forward through the pipe, hand over hand. Panic etching his face as
The motion detector beams STAB DOWN AGAIN. Banning glances back -- and sees the final motion detecto beam a HALF-INCH behind the sole of his left shoe. Relieved, he continues on.
Kang calmly steps to the head of the presidential bunker he owns the building. And, indeed, he does.
I don’t know who the hell you are -- Kang regards Asher evenly.

I’m the man who’s just taken the most secure building on Earth. Asher’s gaze nervously flicks to his MILITARY AIDE nearby black BRIEFCASE attached via security cable to his wrist. The NUCLEAR FOOTBALL. KANG (cont’d) (knowing) I’m not interested in your launch codes, Mr. President. Which by now I’m sure your Pentagon has changed... Minister Lee stares, stunned by Kang’s betrayal.
What are you doing?  37.
Open your eyes, Minister Lee. Our homeland is divided. Our people are divided. Because of these Americans...
(falters) But -- our countries were working toward peace -- Kang begins to walk slowly toward Lee.

Does your “peace” involve millions of our Northern brothers, dead from famine and disease? (he draws closer) Our families separated by tanks and guns and American mines? Kang stands before Lee. KANG (cont’d) No, Minister Lee, this is war. (beat) The time has come for all Korea to again be one. Lee holds Kang’s gaze.
You're a traitor. Kang slowly leans forward, face barely an inch from the Minister’s. We just saw what happened to the last person Kang got thi close to. A bead of sweat slides down Lee’s temple.
(evenly) I’m a patriot. Kang turns and walks away. Lee can breathe again.  38.

The National Military Command Center (aka Crisis Room) of Pentagon. A cavernous space, massive conference table the size of an aircraft carrier. Trumbull strides in, flanked by Homeland Security agents. RAJIV MALIK, 45, Deputy Director of the National Security Agency, steps forward. A lanky, almost gaunt man. Dark ey hiding a formidable intelligence.
Speaker Trumbull. Rajiv Malik, NSA. Since the attack, we’ve had no contact with the White House --
Nothing?
No, sir. They share a look. On the massive wallscreen, a breaking LIVE NEWS BROADCAST.

...the whereabouts of President Benjamin Asher -- if indeed, he is still alive -- are not known at this time... (dramatic beat) For the first time in two hundred years, when the British burned the “President’s House”, as it was then known, during the War of 1812, a foreign enemy occupies the White House.
Banning continues to crawl forward. His rasping breaths E in the pitch-black pipe.
The Secret Service Director, LYNNE JACOBS, late 40s, Afri American, strides up to Trumbull and Malik.  39.
Speaker Trumbull, the White House perimeter has been secured, sir. But all communications with Olympus are still severed.
(low) What a disaster -- Across the room, KANG’S FACE suddenly appears on the enor wallscreen.
Mr. Trumbull. The whole room jumps. Kang’s eyes fix on Trumbull. Trumbu blinks, taken aback.
Kang stands before the massive PEOC control console.
My name is Yeonsak Kang. The man who now controls your White House.
A whirlwind of emotion sweeps the Crisis Room.
Let me speak to the President. Asher is hauled forward at gunpoint. TRUMBULL (cont’d) Sir, are you all right? Before Asher can say anything, he’s jerked away.

In addition to your President, I hold your Vice President, full National Security Team, and South Korean Foreign Minister Lee inside the President’s Emergency Operations Center -- Kang’s looming face remains inscrutable.  40. KANG (cont’d) I understand it’s impregnable. Trumbull swallows.
What do you want?
I want you to recall the U.S. Seventh Fleet from the Sea of Japan.
Wait a minute. We can’t just -- In one smooth motion, Kang turns and SHOOTS Foreign Minis Lee through the head. The hostages recoil, horrified.
You have 12 hours. The wallscreen GOES DARK. Everyone in the Crisis Room sta in shock. A long beat. GENERAL EDWARD GALDARRES, 50s, the Army Chief of Staff, t to Trumbull.

If we recall the Fleet -- and the North attacks -- Seoul and the whole of South Korea could fall within seventy-two hours. Trumbull falters, stunned. GALDARRES (cont’d) Our only recourse would be our long-range ICBMs --
-- which no doubt would bring in the Chinese first, then the Russians -- (beat) -- goddamn nuclear holocaust --  41. They all trade looks.
But if we don’t recall the Fleet, they kill the President.

Bruised and exhausted, Banning reaches the end of the pip A steel ACCESS DOOR looms before him. Banning pulls out his master key. He stops short, thinkin Then -- working fast -- he unscrews the end of the master key. A specially-designed BUMPER KEY slides out. Banning slips the mechanical-only key into the keyway. Presses a button on the key which causes it to VIBRATE fo few seconds. EXTREME CLOSE-UP: Inside the lock, the mechanical motor i the cylinder turns, lifting the locking element within -- bypassing the electronic portion of the lock and thwartin audit logs -- and the lock RELEASES. The access door OPENS -- and Banning’s eyes ZOOM to the L indicator light. It remains dark. He exhales.
Banning drops into a sub-basement corridor. Cautiously mo down the hallway. He turns the corner and
swings his way in a whir of servos. Banning shrinks back. Moves quickly in the opposite direction.
Kang crosses to Secretary of Defense McMillan. She looks eyes afraid.  42.
(without preamble) Give me your Cerberus code. McMillan blinks. Asher and Hoenig exchange a stunned look How the hell does Kang know about Cerberus?
I -- I have no such code -- Kang opens the stainless steel briefcase. Inside the foam lined case is a large-gauge HYPODERMIC NEEDLE and several GLASS VIALS. McMillan’s face turns white.
Think harder, Madame Secretary.
Banning turns the corner, peers down the next corridor. It’s the scene of a MASSACRE. Dead Secret Service agents everywhere. Up ahead, the sound of distant VOICES.

Black-clad commandos surround the two SUVs crashed into t main entrance hall. Cho barks orders in Korean. Banning warily peers around the corner. In the entrance hall, large MILITARY-STYLE CRATES are off loaded from the rear of the SUVs. POV BANNING: He can’t quite make out what they are. Cho issues more orders in Korean. The only word distinguishable to Banning is one -- “Cerberus”. Cho’s men load the crates into the freight elevator. The elevator doors close, and the lift begins to rise. Silently, Banning retreats.  43.
Kang pulls the hypodermic from its case. Lim seizes McMillan from behind, holding her fast. The ot commandos level their MP-5s, cowing any would-be heroes.
What are you doing?! Kang holds up one of the small vials.

Fuante Shi. One of the world’s most deadly orders of strychnine -- He fills the syringe with the vial’s contents. KANG (cont’d) -- no known antidote -- McMillan struggles, but Lim tightens her iron grip. Kang turns with the needle. KANG (cont’d) One more chance. Your Cerberus code. McMillan glances desperately at Asher. KANG (cont’d) He can’t help you. Asher and McMillan exchange a look. McMillan turns back t Kang, face firm with resolve. KANG (cont’d) There’s a saying in Korea -- “Listening 100 times is not as good as seeing it once.” Kang INJECTS her straight in the carotid.
No!!! McMillan JERKS VIOLENTLY in her chair. Her eyes ROLL WILD body THRASHING. The hostages react, horrified. Finally, she goes still.
Not looking up, Kang methodically replaces the syringe in case as he calmly speaks.

Do you cry when your Predators scorch villages? When your “smart bombs” kill innocents from 60 miles away? Kang pushes a button on the control console. The door to PEOC LIVING QUARTERS -- adjacent to the main room -- slid OPEN. We catch a glimpse inside -- a half-dozen cots, kitchenette, supplies. Foreign Minister Lee lies dead on the first cot. Kang’s men drag McMillan’s body into the room -- and the CLOSES.

Banning moves down the silent corridor. More dead bodies down here. He kneels beside a fallen agent, turns him over -- IT’S ROMA Banning blinks, recognition dawning. He pulls the SHURIKEN from Roma’s forehead. Studies the exotic weapon briefly, then pockets it. Banning quickly searches Roma’s body. Already stripped of all weapons and communications gear. Gently, he closes Roma’s staring eyes. Distant FOOTSTEPS. Banning spins, head cocked. Someone’s coming. Quickly, he ducks into the near doorway. As around the corner --

strides down the corridor. The commandos march forward, footfalls echoing. The larger commando suddenly stops, turning.  45. He bends over Roma’s body, fingers probing the open gash the man’s forehead... The shuriken is gone. The commandos both turn. Stare at the doorway through whi Banning just disappeared.

The commandos burst inside. Flick on the lights. Two gleaming polished lanes, Presidential SEAL painted on far wall. Silent pins standing like sentinels. The killers scan the empty room, guns leveled, when
pops from the automatic ball return. The ball ROLLS slowly around the return carousel. Comes t rest against the rubber bumper with a thump. The commandos approach warily when

leaps from the transom above. Swinging a 12-pounder like sledgehammer -- he CRUSHES one commando’s skull. The second commando swings his weapon up. In a blur, Bann KNOCKS the gun away. He and the commando go down -- viciously GRAPPLING across the floor -- a furious FLURRY BLOWS. Banning drives his elbow up -- like a knife -- int the COMMANDO’S THROAT. The commando falters, stunned. Banning SPINS the commando against the ball rack -- grabs by the neck -- SLAMS his head into the stacked balls. Aga and again, body flooded with adrenaline and fear. The commando’s body slides to the floor, dead. Banning falls back, sucking air in great whooping gasps. He methodically searches the bodies. Grabs an MP-5 and wireless headset, clicks the unit on. Nothing but silence Banning looks up, mind racing.  46.
Malik steps beside Trumbull. Inserts a USB device into th computer console. A DIGITAL HEAD SHOT of Kang is projected onto the wallscr Bio-data scrolls below.

Yeonsak Kang. South Korean national, born in the North, birthdate unknown. Escaped across the DMZ as a child, both parents reportedly killed by ROK mines in the attempt -- A second PHOTO appears. Kang in military garb. MALIK (cont'd) Kang has served for the past six years in Seoul’s diplomatic protection corps, following two tours in South Korea’s elite Black Tiger counter-terror unit.
So he knows what he’s doing -- Jacobs looks up.
And clearly will stop at nothing to get it.
The Oval Office stands silent and empty. The door slowly swings open and

slips inside. He crosses to the presidential desk, rests his MP-5 on th blotter. A bank of PHONES sit mutely. Banning grabs the receivers, one after another. No dial tones. All dead.  47. He scans the desktop. Scattered papers, a Montblanc pen, ivory-handled letter opener -- THE PRESIDENT’S BLACKBERRY Banning grabs it. Punches 9-1-1. All lines are JAMMED. He can’t get through. Banning scowls, looks up. And his eyes go wide, as he’s utterly shocked to see
standing silently in the Oval Office doorway.
(slowly) What are you doing here? Banning opens his mouth to speak when
steps through the side door. Connor spins and runs. Banning’s eyes jerk to his weapon. He’1ll never make it. commando raises his gun barrel and
grabs the letter opener. Flings it across the room. The blade spears the commando in the jugular. He falls, h clutching his throat. Banning grabs the MP-5. Races after Connor.
Connor sprints down the hall. Banning gives chase. The bo disappears through an inner office doorway. Banning rushes up. Grabs the doorknob. Locked. He KICKS the door down.  48.

Banning bursts inside, eyes searching the small room. Des bookshelves, low filing cabinets. Connor is... gone. But that’s impossible. Banning stares, confused. He pulls out Asher’s BlackBerry. Scrolls down the listing Finds the one he wants... National Military Command Center. He dials. Lines still jammed. Dials again...
Trumbull presides over the somber room.
What if this Kang is just some out- of-control rogue?

And if he’s not? He’s providing a hostile regime with the window of opportunity they’ve been seeking for the past sixty years -- His eyes flicker around the table. GALDARRES (cont’d) What will become of America’s credibility as a superpower, if we allow our ally to be overrun? Jacobs counters, angry.
How will we be seen in the eyes of the world -- if we let our President be killed in his own goddamn house?! Jacobs’ AIDE rushes up, whispers urgently in her ear.
JACOBS (cont’d) (spins, to Trumbull) We have contact from inside the White House -- trace confirms it’s the President’s cell --
Patch it through. Feedback whine from the overhead speakers. TRUMBULL (cont’d) Mr. President?
Banning slumps against the desk.
No --
(into intercom) Identify yourself.
Echelon 4. Jacobs’ head jerks up.
(low, to Jacobs) He’s one of yours -- ? Jacobs holds up her hand -- wait.
(into intercom) Designator?
Oscar-Zulu, three-zero-niner.
(incredulous) Banning? A stir races through the room.  50.
Yeah --
This is Director Jacobs --
Where’s POTUS?

As of 1020 hours, the Fox Den. (quickly) The President and National Security team are being held by a North Korean named Kang. They’ve already killed Foreign Minister -- Trumbull snaps off the intercom.
What’re you doing?
He’s a Special Agent --
Who should’ve been shitcanned two years ago -- Jacobs and Trumbull lock eyes.
He got in -- didn’t he?
Lim triangulates the source of the cell transmission -- A DOT blinking on the wallscreen map of the White House.
Pak halts his men in their search through the building.
(over headset) West Wing. First Floor. Pak grunts, leads his men quickly down the corridor.  51.
Jacobs switches the intercom back on.
Banning -- ?
What do they want?
The Seventh Fleet pulled -- by 2200 hours. BANNING (realizing what that means) You can’t do that --
Spare us the geopolitical advice, Agent --
(cuts him off) What’s Cerberus? This stops Trumbull cold. The others share a look.
What -- how did you -- ?
-- that’s classified --
Kang knows. Their faces darken. Beat. Trumbull reluctantly nods to Jacobs.
It’s a fail-safe protocol. Alpha Top Secret. But it has no offensive capability...  52.
What kind of fail-safe?
Against inadvertent nuclear launch. The three Cerberus codes, when activated, control the self- destruct mechanisms within our ICBMs.
(realization dawning) With those codes -- Kang could destroy every long-range nuke we fire. With the Seventh Fleet pulled, South Korea would be defenseless.
And so would we. Their faces are tense.
So change the codes --
No --
What do you mean, no --

He means we can’t. (beat) Cerberus is a self-contained total-isolation system. It’s unidirectional -- data only goes out, not in. The only way to change the codes is to physically do so on the computer itself.
Where’s the computer?
The PEOC. The enormity of the situation strikes home for them all.  53.
The three codes -- who has them?
Kang approaches Admiral Hoenig with his hypodermic needle Loads in a fresh vial.
Admiral. Your Cerberus code.
You don’t know what you’re doing --
Don’t I? Kang looms over Hoenig, eyes black as anthracite. KANG (cont’d) I’m providing my nation with the opportunity to achieve its rightful destiny. Hoenig’s glance flickers to the syringe.
You’re not a patriot. (beat) You’re a psychopath --

I believe Seneca said it best -- “There is no genius without a touch of madness.” Kang places the point of the needle against Hoenig’s caro KANG (cont’d) Your code, Admiral. Kang’s finger tenses on the plunger. A beat of incredible tension.
(slowly) E-M-six... zero-eight... two-five. Kang lowers the syringe.  54.
Pak and his men creep down the corridor. Pak listens to h tac-com, gets a fix on Banning’s exact location. He stops. Silently points to the NEXT OFFICE DOOR.
The commandos burst inside, FIRING ON FULL AUTO -- ASHER’S BLACKBERRY sits on the desktop. GETS BLASTED into a million pieces a bullets rake the room. Banning is gone.
CLOSE ON WALLSCREEN: A SATCOM PHOTO of the post-attack Wh House.
All indications are the White House air defenses were destroyed in the attack. With this defense grid gone, they could be vulnerable to a nighttime aerial insertion --
And if you’re wrong? Malik steps forward.
We have no choice. (beat) We’ve got to get the President out of there. We’ve got to secure Cerberus. All eyes turn to Trumbull. Beat.
General, activate your team. Galdarres nods, grabs the hotline phone. Malik turns and exits the room. Pulls out his cell and presses it to his  55.
(low) Awaken the Sandman.
Banning moves silently up the stairwell to the State Floo Turns the corner and
stand watch on the landing. The killers and Banning see e other at the same instant. Banning’s reflexes are a millisecond faster. He MOWS DOWN both commandos with a burst from his MP-5.
At the blast of GUNFIRE, Pak barks into his tac-com.
(in Korean, subtitled) All units, State Floor!
Banning races up the stairs, into the Cross Hall. A COMMANDO leaps from the near doorway, gun leveled. Banning dives into the Red Room, gunfire STITCHING the wa
Kang speaks into his throat mic.
Mr. Cho.
The machine floor just below the White House roof. Low HU of compressors. Cho stands beside a huge HYDRAULIC LIFT.  56.
(into tac-com) Cho here.
(filtered) Is the package ready?
Almost there -- Cho goes back to his mysterious work.

Banning runs for his life. Into the Blue Room. Bullets RA the walls, plaster fragments raining down. Banning looks up, dust stinging his eyes. A sober painting of GEORGE WASHINGTON stares down from th wall above. Banning and old George share a look. Warriors across time A barrage of machine gun slugs OBLITERATES the painting. Time to move. Banning dives behind a Louis XIV couch. A hail of bullets SHREDS it to ribbons. Banning hugs the floor -- bullets WHINING -- crawls quick toward the East Room when

steps into the doorway. Banning rolls as the commando fires, slugs STITCHING acro the hardwood. He swings his barrel up -- And BLASTS the gunman through the wall. Banning’s up fast. Into the East Room.
Banning SPRAYS behind him, through the open doorway.  57. CLICK. He’s empty! He discards the useless MP-5. Eyes wildly searching.
Pak leads the commandos forward. Signals two men to rush East Room.
Banning grabs a bottle of gin from the liquor cart.
The two commandos move stealthily forward when
explodes through the doorway. Splashing fire ENGULFS both men. They spin across the room screaming, AFLAME.
Banning frantically lights two more bottles, HURLS them i the Cross Hall.

Banning sprints into the corridor, ducking behind the wal flame. Wild gunfire ECHOES. The White House HALOCARBON FIRE-SUPPRESSION SYSTEM ACTIVA quickly neutralizes the spreading blaze. Banning races up the stairs to the Second floor.
The Second floor (living quarters) of the White House. Pak’s commandos converge from both ends. KICKING DOWN doo searching room by room. Relentless. Methodical.
Banning crouches low in the Lincoln Bedroom, cornered.  58. No way out.
Pak and his men close in.
Weaponless, Banning braces for the inevitable. Last stand When suddenly --
A large box molding square subtly shifts. Banning stares, incredulous, as
emerges from the wall.
(whispers) Mike, hurry --
Pak looms outside the bedroom door.
Pak CRASHES inside, MP-5 SPRAYING the room. He blinks.
Pak stares, eyes flat. His tac-com crackles.
(filtered) Return to the bunker. Pak motions his men out. Scans the empty room one final t himself, then exits.  59.
Pak’s men file into the elevator car. The doors close.
From the mainframe console, Lim controls the elevator’s descent. Kang hovers over her shoulder.
Initiate lockdown. Lim punches a button... Activating the full White House internal security grid.
Throughout the Executive Mansion -- infrared, thermal, an motion sensor beams WINK ON. Crisscrossing every hallway, stairway and room in the building.

The wallscreen subdivides into hundreds of VIDEO FEEDS -- monitoring every conceivable inch of the White House. No living thing can escape such technology. As soon as Banning moves, he’1ll be exposed. Kang’s eyes stay fixed on the wall of TV images. There is no place to hide.
There is no place to hide. Except... Banning is being led by Connor through the walls. Ducking low -- shoulders barely squeezing through -- Bann follows the boy through the dim passageways.  60.

Always knew Truman gutted the interior in ‘49 -- new steel frame erected around the original stone walls -- Connor looks back, tight smile. A veritable tunnel rat. BANNING (cont’ d) -- but my God, Connor -- The kid spins, continues on. It’s literally a “house-within-a-house”. Secret corridors hidden doors. It would take literally weeks -- months -- figure out the whole of this bewildering labyrinth. Indeed the only one with the size, inclination, and time uncover the full extent of such a maze might be... An 8-year-old boy.

Outside, night has fallen. A commando steps onto the roof, loads what looks like a T GLIDER -- a Wasp III Micro Air Vehicle (MAV) drone -- ont slingshot, and LAUNCHES it into the sky. On silent wings, the Wasp circles up... circles up... and disappears into the night sky.

Rotors whirring, the SEAL TEAM SIX choppers idle on the tarmac. Three stealth-modified BLACK HAWK troop carriers five APACHE LONGBOW gunships, fully armed. On the runway, the SEAL Team Six leader, MAJOR HOLT, 30s, greets Secret Service Agent O’Neil (recognizable from the Camp David opening). O’Neil wears a flak vest and helmet.
Agent O’Neil? O’ NEIL Major --  61. Both men turn for the command chopper.
We’1l make sure you get in. You just get my men into that PEOC --
Kang scans the wallscreen images, perplexed. His eyes suddenly narrow.
Screen 26. Lim punches a button. VIDEO DISPLAY: The Lincoln Bedroom. KANG (cont’d) Quadrant four. Lim zooms in. KANG (cont’d) Enhance. Kang’s eyes focus on the far bedroom wall --

head_text.subj: THE BOX MOLDING IS SLIGHTLY OFF CENTER

text: Kang thinly smiles.

Holt and his men check their weapons, ready for takeoff. A muscular BLONDE MAN suddenly sprints across the tarmac. Dressed in the same special ops gear as SEAL Team Six. He vaults into the open chopper door. This is the SANDMAN.

Who the hell are you? Sandman looks up with piercing blue eyes. Hands Holt his orders.  62. Holt reads, glances up. He doesn’t like it, but turns and motions the chopper pilot. HOLT (cont’d) Take her up. O’Neil glances at Sandman. Sandman stares back, face a ma The choppers LIFT OFF. Baffled stealth ROTOR BLADES eeril making almost no sound.
Banning and Connor rest a moment, safe within the walls. boy eyes Banning -- filthy, exhausted, bleeding -- warily
You really saved my hide back there, partner. The boy shrugs. An awkward silence. Banning puts on the captured commando headset. Listens frowning. BANNING (cont’d) ...nothing... Connor looks up.
Is my dad okay?
(hesitates) I don’t know, buddy. The boy struggles to keep from crying. Beat.

(re: headset) Can I see? Banning hands him the headset. Connor hunches over it, fiddling with the mute device. CONNOR (cont’d) (not looking up) When you left... you never said goodbye.  63. Banning swallows.
I didn’t think you’d want me to. Connor reaches around. Slowly pulls something from his ba pocket --
The words “U.S. SECRET SERVICE” stitched across its front The boy snugs the cap firmly atop his head. Banning chokes up. Connor bends over the headset. His voice is very small.
My dad says it was an accident. That it was no one’s fault... Banning swallows.
(hesitant) Is that what you think?
Maybe no one could have saved her. Banning stares, numb. Awed by the simple pure forgiveness a child.
SEAL Team Six en route. Locked and loaded.
Lights out, rotors muffled, the stealth choppers SKIM ove the city. Passing over like phantoms.
A mile above SEAL Team Six’s target --  64.

circles above the White House, like a silent bird of prey stealth black batwing. CLOSE ON: The CAMERA EYE on the drone’s underbelly -- an ARGUS-IS 1.8 gigapixel electro-optic (EO) camera and infr imager. The unblinking eye stares down.
A uniformed TECH turns from his monitor screen.
Sentinel’s on station, sir.
Give me eyes on.
The Sentinel’s night-vision EO camera WHIRS.
On the monitor screen, the ARGUS system’s real-time, high resolution image DISPLAYS.
Visual up, sir. Galdarres studies the screen. The night-vision picture is perfect... The White House roof is empty, unmanned, unprotected.
Bastards will never know what hit ‘em.
Banning frowns, thinking.  65.
(off Banning’s look) What’s wrong?

Just can’t figure it. Why they’re giving us twelve hours. They had to know it wouldn’t take anywhere near that to recall the Fleet -- His brow furrows. BANNING (cont'd) Why do they need more time? Connor shrugs, tinkering with the commando headset. BANNING (cont’d) (low, to himself) They have everything they need to access Cerberus... His mind works, feverishly trying to figure it out. BANNING (cont’d) (realization dawning) ...everything except... Banning slowly looks up -- at Connor. The headset suddenly SPUTTERS TO LIFE.
I did it! Banning grabs the tac-com, puts it to his ear. And hears, impossibly, the FEEDBACK WHINE of another head unit directly behind him. Banning whirls and

launches himself out of the darkness, gun raised. Banning grabs the killer’s Glock. They CRASH into the wal The Glock fires, gunshot BOOMING in the confined space.  66. The commando forces the muzzle into Banning’s face. Banni JAMS his thumb inside the trigger guard -- preventing the gun’s discharge. The killer squeezes, pistol trigger CRUSHING Banning’s thumb. Grimacing, Banning presses the killer’s skull against the steel wall joist. Slowly -- inexorably -- the commando’s neck bends back. Banning pushes with every last ounce of leverage...
(voice tight, to Connor) Look away --
The killer goes still. Banning falls back, chest heaving. Connor looks up. Stares numbly at the lifeless corpse. Banning scrambles for the headset, puts it back on. Grabs the fallen Glock.
The SEAL Team choppers streak in low over Washington.
Lim stares into a small MONITOR SCREEN, deftly working a toggle-like CONTROLLER. CLOSE ON SCREEN: POV of the Wasp III drone -- LOOKING DOW The stealth choppers approach, closing fast.
Here they come... Kang speaks into his throat mic. (NOTE: Banning hears all the following over his captured headset.]
Mr. Cho.
Cho presses his hand against his earpiece.  67.
The package is ready.
(filtered) Stand by to repel boarders.
Banning spins.
The roof! Banning and Connor scramble down the dim passageway.
Cho presses a button on the control panel. Hydraulic gear WHINING, the lift platform begins to RISE.
Banning and Connor hurry through the narrow passages.
The SEAL Team activates their night vision goggles. Lense glowing GHOSTLY GREEN.
Two minutes to target. O’Neil reaches up, flips his goggles ON. POV O’NEIL: The rooftops rush past below, crazily fast. A luminous wash of spectral green.
Heavy lift rising, Cho and his men race for the fire stai THREE COMMANDOS are left behind to stand guard.  68.
Banning hears the grinding HYDRAULICS above. Quickly clim an interior wall ladder.
Two enormous metal doors slowly OPEN on the White House r Inside, the lift continues to rise.
The tech spins from his monitor.
We have movement on the roof, sir! Galdarres and the others stare at the screen.
The SEAL Team choppers flash over Georgetown.
(filtered) Sixty seconds to target.

Hunched low, Banning and Connor hurry down the dim passag directly below the roof sub-level. Banning stops, eyes searching. He sees an ancient (1930's era) metal ACCESS DOOR PANEL, encrusted with decades of rust and grit. Banning pulls on the door -- it opens with a stubborn SCREECH. Banning lif Connor, sets him inside the CRAWL SPACE within.
I gotta get to the roof. Stay here -- okay? The boy nods, eyes afraid. Banning tweaks his cap, shoots him a reassuring look. He closes the door panel, Connor s behind it.  69.
Heavy machinery HUMS. A VENTILATION GRATE slowly opens in the floor and

peers out. The three commandos stand guard, facing away. Banning hoists himself up onto the floor. Silently moves forward, Glock raised -- The nearest commando’s eyes flicker. The commando whirls -- KNOCKING the Glock from Banning’s hand. He raises his own weapon and -- Banning’s hand flashes down -- SNAP! -- SHATTERING the commando’s forearm. Banning grabs the commando -- SPINS h to the ground -- lands on top -- twists -- SNAPS the commando’s neck. Banning ROLLS as -- the second commando -- still unslingi his weapon -- tries to get off a shot. Banning’s foot las out -- like a piston -- PULVERIZES the commando’s knee. H grabs the man -- lightning fast -- open palm driving up i the COMMANDO’S JAW. Spins him around just as the third commando starts FIRING -- The rounds THUD into the second commando -- body jerking KILLING him instantly. Banning uses the body as a shield HURLS the corpse into the third commando -- Banning and the third commando CRASH into the wall. Banni kicks out -- connects with the commando’s weapon -- the g goes flying. The two roll across the floor, furiously GRAPPLING.
Lim stares into her small monitor screen. Continuing to w the toggle controller.
Ms. Lim --
Almost there...  70.
The Sentinel drone continues its fixed surveillance patte Camera eye focused on the ground below. When, unseen, coming in silently from above --
swoops down, lands on the Sentinel’s back. Magnetic sucti like feet CLAMPING onto the larger drone.
Lim presses a button on her controller.
SSSZZZPPP! The Wasp sends a massive ELECTROMAGNETIC PULSE coursing through the larger drone. The Sentinel instantly heels over and plummets from the s

All eyes fixed on the multiple wallscreen REAL-TIME VIDEO FEEDS. Following the assault via both the chopper-mounted CAMERAS and eye-in-the-sky drone. The Sentinel’s surveillance screen suddenly BLACKS OUT.
What the --
The drone. What happened? The tech frantically works his controls.

Banning and the commando continue to viciously battle. Exchanging a savage, brutal series of hand-to-hand BLOWS. The commando SWEEP KICKS Banning off his feet. He pounces seizes Banning from behind -- grips him in a steel vise C HOLD.  71. Banning sags to his knees. Through bulging eyes, Banning sees the large crates lying open on the machine floor. Stenciled boldly across the si of the nearest one are the words...

head_text.subj: U.S. ARMY WEAPONS PROTOTYPE HYDRA SERIES 6A

text: The lift continues to rise.
Everyone continues to stare at the BLANK surveillance dro screen. Faces tense.
We need that visual, corporal --
I’m trying, sir. An AIDE rushes up, hands Galdarres a file marked “CLASSIF
Crash report from the attack plane wreckage, sir. (talking fast) Report confirms this morning’s C-130 was armed with an M-111 VGL prototype --
What?
The next generation of directed energy weapon. We call it the “Blind Bomb”. Effective range up to 2000 meters.
How the hell did they get one of those? Galdarres rapidly flips through the report.  72.

(reading) Six months ago -- joint U.S.-South Korean experimental weapons testing -- a C-5A out of Osan Air Base went down in the Sea of Japan -- (keeps reading) -- reported lost were a VGL prototype and an Advanced Hydra Phalanx Weapons System -- Galdarres’ face goes white. GALDARRES (cont’d) (frantic) We need to abort -- He spins. Finger stabbing for the intercom.
On the White House roof, the heavy lift CLANKS to a stop. The lift which originally housed the destroyed Avenger ai defenses. The lift upon which now sits...
The Hydra springs to life in a WHIR OF SERVOS. Six deadly barrels sweeping the sky, computerized targeting systems searching for prey. We have never seen anything like this before.
Suddenly, out of nowhere --
ZOOM UP AND OVER the Treasury Annex, rotors whirring. The Hydra reacts INSTANTLY, opening up with a CHAINSAW RO The two foremost choppers EXPLODE.
Holt bellows into his headset.  73.
All birds! Evade! Evade! An armor-piercing ROUND drills Holt through the forehead. The SEAL Team Six leader is killed instantly.

Banning struggles in the commando’s grip, face crimson. BITES DOWN on the commando’s knuckles, crunching bone. Th commando’s hold breaks. Banning flips him over his head. The commando spins -- up fast -- combat knife unsheathed. rushes Banning, SLAMS him into an electrical transformer. The commando dives atop Banning, throttling him. The gleaming blade bears down -- razored point an inch from Banning’s STARING EYE. With a final jerk -- Banning spins his attacker -- comman knife PLUNGING into the transformer’s exposed circuitry. Banning rolls away as 120,000 VOLTS SURGE through the met blade and into the commando’s body. The commando THRASHES WILDLY, turning black. Then goes still. Banning lunges to his feet, races for the control panel. finger STABS the lift button. Hydraulics whining, the lift begins to DESCEND.

The SEAL Team choppers furiously juke. Chain guns and Hellfire missiles BLASTING AWAY. It’s a surreal sight. American combat choppers unleashing MISSILE BARRAGE on their own White House. The Hydra mercilessly RIDDLES another Black Hawk. The tro ship EXPLODES, incinerating all ten men aboard.
Connor cowers inside the dark enclosed space. Eyes dartin as the GUNFIRE and EXPLOSIONS boom distantly above.
The lift continues to descend. Banning desperately wills to go faster.
Come on -- !

The Hydra’s guns swivel and FIRE, swivel and FIRE. Another Apache is RAKED. Rotors spinning, it SHEARS into Black Hawk beside it. Both choppers ERUPT in flame. The roof doors begin to CLOSE. Hydra rounds RICOCHET off heavy steel plates. The lift continues down.

Hydra rounds ricochet inside the closing steel doors. The din is DEAFENING. Banning sprints from the room. The doors continue to close. Hydra’s FURIOUS rate of fire never slowing. The bouncing, incendiary rounds WHIZ everywhere when
bores directly into the Hydra’s ammunition store. THE HYDRA ERUPTS.

The blast practically LIFTS THE ROOF off the White House. Secondary EXPLOSIONS bloom, turning night into day. The last surviving SEAL Team chopper (Holt’s command ship swings in. Troopers rappel down. Cho and his men scramble onto the roof, FIRING. The SEALs are RIDDLED on their fast ropes, when --  75.
leaps onto the roof -- grabs a discarded MP-5 -- guns dow onrushing commando.

head_text.subj: IN THE BLACK HAWK COMMAND SHIP

text: O’Neil furiously FIRES on the enemy below. Beside him, Sandman peers down his XM8 laser-sighted ASSAULT RIFLE.
He drills commandos below with machine-like precision.
Cho fixes the Black Hawk’s tail rotor in his sights.
Sandman zeroes Cho. Finger on the trigger when
rakes both Sandman and O’Neil. Sandman falls from the ope chopper door.

Cho opens up on FULL AUTOMATIC, machine gun unleashing a murderous VOLLEY OF LEAD. The Black Hawk’s tail rotor DISINTEGRATES . The command ship pitches wildly, turbines SCREAMING their death throes. The chopper SLAMS into the White House roof Swinging SEALs fall to their deaths. O’Neil LEAPS from the dying bird. Fingers groping for purchase on the narrow roof ledge. The command ship plummets, CRASHING to the South Lawn bel EXPLODES in a blinding fireball. Banning riddles another commando -- vaulting the body bef it even hits the ground. He sprints forward -- tossing as his weapon and

for O’Neil. Grabs hold of the dangling man’s hand.  76. O’Neil hangs forty feet in the air. Banning’s grip the on thing between his fellow Secret Service agent and death. Their eyes meet. O’ NEIL Banning --
Hold on. I’ve got you --

Cho strides through the swirling smoke and flame. Straining, Banning cranes his neck around. Cho marches purposefully forward. Banning’s gaze flickers to his weapon, mere feet away. He’d have to let go of O’Neil. Cho stops and stands over Banning, eyes flat. Cocks his weapon. Banning is a dead man. Cho raises his barrel and
explodes through Cho’s throat. He falls dead. Banning spins and O’ NEIL stares up, looking past him. Smoking P229 in his hand. O’Neil slumps, pistol falling from his nerveless fingers.
Total SILENCE. Connor listens in the still darkness. Tentative, he pushes open the access panel door. Squeezes out of the tiny crawl space.
Banning strains to hold O’Neil’s dead weight.  77.
Give me your other arm -- O’Neil reaches up. Banning grasps his hand.
Mike? Banning’s head swivels.
Connor wanders across the rooftop. Disoriented by the smo and swirling flame.
(croaks hoarsely) Connor! The boy stumbles blindly through the haze. Behind Connor, Pak and his men vault topside. Pak roughly grabs the boy.
Mike! On the far parapet, obscured by smoke, Banning lies unsee

(weakly) Connor... He stares helplessly as Pak drags the boy away. Banning turns. And with the last of his strength, hauls O’Neil up onto the White House roof. O’Neil stares weakly, mouth twitching. O’ NEIL Always the cowboy... He coughs, gurgling blood.

Hold on, O'Neil -- The light fades from O’Neil’s eyes.  78. O’NEIL You shouldn’t... have left... the boy. He dies. Banning stares across the roof. A nightmare landscape of dead bodies, smoking debris, and flame. Connor is gone.
Kang’s tac-com crackles. He listens.
(into tac-com) Bring him to me.
On the massive wallscreen, VIDEO FOOTAGE of the assault’s disastrous aftermath unfolds. Everyone stares in horror. The wallscreen flickers... and KANG’S FACE appears.
Mr. Trumbull -- Trumbull swallows.
Kang stares, face implacable.

You were warned. Kang turns, and in one smooth motion SHOOTS Vice Presiden Cardoza POINT BLANK IN THE HEAD. KANG (cont’d) Your President is next. Cardoza’s body slumps to the floor, dead.  79. KANG (cont’d) You now have one hour to recall the Seventh Fleet. When this is done, I want Marine One on the South Lawn fueled and ready. (beat) One hour. Kang terminates the transmission.
The digital wall clock reads 9:48.
(to Trumbull) We’ve got no choice. You have to recall the Fleet.
But, Mr. Speaker --
What do you propose, General? These people hold all the cards --
All but one. Everyone looks up. MALIK (cont’d) I took the liberty of dispatching an operative -- one of my own -- to go in with the General’s men.
But the strike team was destroyed --
My asset was not.
How can you be sure?
His bio-sensor’s still tracking. He’s alive.  80. Malik doesn’t blink. MALIK (cont’d) He’s never failed a mission. Trumbull turns to Jacobs.
What about Banning? Could he still be -- Jacobs holds his gaze.
I don’t know.

Banning leans against the low parapet. Bloodied, battered bruised. He stares through the drifting haze, and sees -- CONNOR’S BALL CAP blowing end over end across the debris-strewn roof. Banning reaches out. Clutches the crumpled cap in his fis He gazes down at the cap. The words “U.S. SECRET SERVICE” stare back. Like a beacon across time. Banning straightens. Reaches for O’Neil’s headset.
(into tac-com) -- Director -- do you copy -- ?
Banning’s VOICE comes over the intercom. Everyone spins. Jacobs grabs the microphone.
Banning!  81.
(matter-of-fact) They’re all dead. He grabs a weapon, checks the magazine.
(filtered) Banning -- what -- what are you going to do? Banning strides across the roof, face a mask of resolve.
My job.
Kang pushes a button on the control console. The door to PEOC living quarters slides OPEN.
Admiral, you’1ll come with me -- Hoenig hesitates -- this is the room where the bodies of McMillan and Cardoza were all taken...
No, Nate -- A commando levels his weapon at Hoenig’s chest.
Admiral? On legs of stone, Hoenig stands and slowly crosses the PE Hesitantly steps inside the small room. Kang follows -- and the door CLOSES.
Broken corpses sprawl across the still smoldering roof. Suddenly, one body MOVES. The figure stands amidst the sm and flickering flame --  82.
marches forward, like a machine. Pale eyes like ice.
The massive bunker door opens. Pak enters with Connor.
Connor! The boy runs to his father. ASHER (cont’d) Thank God... Kang roughly SPINS the boy by his arm. Looms over him, fa ominous.
Who’s been helping you? Connor stares back, defiant. Doesn’t answer. Asher pulls his son away, protective.

Got him. Kang turns, crosses to Lim at the control console. On her monitor screen, Lim replays surveillance video fro the machine floor. VIDEO FOOTAGE: A FIGURE surprises the three machine floor guards.

Freeze and process for face recognition. Lim FREEZE-FRAMES the figure’s face, ZOOMING in. Hits a button. HEAD SHOT PHOTOGRAPHS from the government’s full personne database cross-reference the image at blinding speed. The match frame appears. Banning’s ID photo.  83. KANG (cont’d) (reading) Michael Taylor Banning. First Recon Lieutenant -- Silver Star -- (beat, eyes widening) Current Secret Service -- demotion following death ruled accidental -- Margaret Louise Asher. Kang slowly turns -- and locks eyes with the President.
Banning peers down the long hall. Crisscrossed with motio sensor beams. There’s no way past. KANG’S VOICE (0.S.) (amplified) Mike Banning. Kang’s voice BOOMS over the White House intercom system.
Kang studies the monitor screens intently.
Special Agent -- Mike Banning. Banning stays hidden.
A long beat of silence. And then...
(shaky) Mike? This stops Banning in his tracks.

You have 30 seconds to show yourself, Agent Banning. Or I put a bullet in his eye. Banning leans back, closes his eyes.  84. KANG (cont’d) Fifteen seconds. We can tell from Banning’s face this is the hardest decis of his life. KANG (cont’d) Five. Banning leaves his weapon and O’Neil’s tac-com behind, mo into view. Lim’s monitor alarms suddenly TRILL. Banning walks down the corridor in full view, tripping th sensor beams. Unarmed, hands held high. Across the hall, the White House emergency elevator doors suddenly OPEN. Banning steps inside. The doors close.
The wall clock continues its inexorable march. Time’s up. Trumbull hesitates. All eyes on him.
(beat) Recall the Seventh Fleet. A wave of trepidation sweeps the room.
We’ve just cleared the way for the North Korean invasion.
Alarms ECHOING, the emergency elevator doors OPEN. Banning stands inside the elevator car. Three COMMANDOS w outside for him, weapons leveled. The wall-mounted hallway CAMERA zooms in.  85.
Secure in the PEOC, Kang watches the proceedings in the corridor outside on his monitor screen. CLOSE ON MONITOR: Hands raised, Banning steps from the elevator car.
The alarms suddenly SHUT OFF. Dead silence.
(amplified) So this is our Silver Star. Kang’s disembodied VOICE echoes in the corridor. Banning looks up, stares directly into the camera.
Kang regards Banning’s defiant face on the monitor.
(into mic) I’m afraid failure seems to be quite the habit for you...
Banning stands helpless before the armed commandos. The lead commando’s tac-com crackles.
(filtered) Kill him.
Kang watches the lead commando raise his weapon, when suddenly -- THE MONITOR SCREEN WHITES OUT.  86.
The three commandos all drop as if POLE-AXED. Felled by pinpoint silenced rounds to the head. Banning jerks up and
peers down the barrel of his XM8 at the far end of the ha Sandman lowers his weapon, strides quickly forward.
Who are you?
Sandman marches for the PEOC door. Banning grabs a weapon from a dead commando.
The bunker’s sealed -- Sandman pulls a small REMOTE DEVICE from his web harness.
All the monitor screens are jagged with SNOWY INTERFERENC
What’s happening? Lim frantically works the controls, tries to restore the static-filled screens.

-- I’ve lost override -- The massive bunker door suddenly CHIMES. Pak and the othe commandos all spin, weapons leveled. Kang quickly steps behind the seated Asher, puts his gun the President’s temple. The titanium door slowly SWINGS OPEN.  87. SWIRLING HAZE from smoke grenades drifts in. We can’t see thing. Kang’s men train their weapons on the bunker entrance. Re to blow away anything the instant it appears. Seconds pass, seeming like hours. When suddenly
bounces through the smoky haze.
(neutral, robotic) Lower your weapons -— The pinpoint laser comes to rest squarely on Kang’s foreh Through the swirling smoke...
step into the bunker. Sandman keeps his XM8 trained on Ka Banning covers Pak and the other commandos.
-- nobody move --
Mike!
It’s okay, partner -- Banning makes eye contact with Asher across the room. The two share a look.
Come with me, sir -- I’m getting you out of here --
Not without the others. Sandman’s eyes imperceptibly flicker -- instantly taking the enemy weapons -- the number of hostages -- mind coldl calculating the odds. They’1ll never make it.  88.
Those aren’t my orders.
I’m not leaving without them -- Shockingly, Sandman’s laser dot moves from Kang’s forehea to Asher’s.

(to Sandman) -- the fuck -- Pak and his men raise their weapons -- Kang halts them. Sandman keeps his gun trained on the President. BANNING (cont’d) (to Sandman) What the hell are you doing? Asher stares at Sandman, eyes knowing.

He knows exactly what he’s doing. Sandman stares down his weapon. ASHER (cont’d) He wasn’t sent to protect me. (beat) He was sent to protect Cerberus. Kang turns his weapon on Sandman. Banning shifts, takes d aim at Kang.

(to Sandman) Take your weapon off the President. Sandman doesn’t move. Laser dot steady on Asher. He knows Kang needs Asher alive -- needs Asher’s code. Would Sandman actually kill his own President in order to protect Cerberus? Kang and Sandman LOCK EYES. Both frozen like statues, neither moving a muscle. CLOSE ON SANDMAN: Face a stony mask, ice-blue eyes starin back at Kang, when...  89. ...the slightest twitch. BANNING (cont’ d) No! Kang FIRES, hitting Sandman -- Banning SIMULTANEOUSLY KNO SANDMAN’S BARREL UPWARD as the XM8 unloads on FULL AUTO - bullets BLASTING the wall just above Asher’s head -- Pak and the other commandos OPEN FIRE. The whole room ERU IN GUNFIRE, hostages DIVING FOR COVER. Banning spins, FIRING -- CUTS ONE OF THE COMMANDOS IN HAL Sandman is caught in the CROSSFIRE, BODY JERKING FROM THE HITS. He sprays on FULL AUTOMATIC -- taking out half the commandos in the room -- refusing to go down -- Asher PROTECTIVELY SHIELDS Connor with his body. Banning CUT OFF from them. He LUNGES for the President -- but Pak DRIVES HIM BACK with a WITHERING burst of fire. Sandman’s RIDDLED BODY falls to the ground, dead. The RELENTLESS GUNFIRE explodes around Banning. No choice He rolls -- FIRING -- DIVES through the bunker door, BULL WHINING. Pak LEAPS UP, takes off after Banning.
Banning HAULS ASS down the corridor. CRASHES into the fir stairwell.
Banning checks his weapon. Half a clip left. He cracks the door. Cautiously peers out and

stitch the fire door, sparks FLYING. Pak advances down the hall, FIRING from the hip. Banning ducks back.  90. He looks up. The stairwell soars above him. Flight after flight, seeming to go forever. Banning races up the stairs. Behind him and below, the fire door SLAMS OPEN. Pak swiftly climbs, pursuing.
Kang stands over Asher.

So your protector fails you -- as he failed your wife -- Kang glances at Connor. KANG (cont’d) -- and your son -- Kang turns, kneels beside Sandman’s corpse.
