Pulls the sma remote from the dead man’s web harness. Kang flicks the switch. The monitor screens go back ON-LI He drops the device to the floor -- CRUSHING IT under his boot. Lim suddenly spins from the control console.
They’ re recalling the Fleet.
Was there ever a doubt? Asher glares at Kang.
You just opened the door to Armageddon.
No, Mr. President. You did.  91.
Banning RACES up the endless flights, breathing hard. Pak relentlessly pursues. Banning peers down the stairwell. A burst EXPLODES past h face, bullets whining. Banning keeps climbing.
Kang violently yanks Connor from his father.

Now, Mr. President -- He presses his gun to the boy’s temple. KANG (cont’d) Your code. Connor looks up, face filled with fear. Asher locks eyes with his terrified son. Kang COCKS his weapon. A long, excruciating beat.
D-R-seven-two-five-six-nine. Kang releases the boy, triumphant.
(into tac-com) All units. We’re leaving.
Throughout the White House, sentries abandon their posts race down the halls.
Asher glares at Kang, defiant.  92.

But it’s no good to you -- Kang nods to his men, who sling black shoulder bags. ASHER (cont'd) -- without the codes of the Joint Chief’s Chairman and Defense Secretary, mine’s useless -- The commandos begin herding the hostages from the bunker. ASHER (cont’d) -- you murdered McMillan before she could -- Kang pushes a button on the control console. The door to PEOC living quarters slides open and
is hauled back into the PEOC. Very much alive. McMillan’s eyes meet Asher’s. Asher’s face turns white.
Mr. President -- I’m sorry -- Asher gapes, dumbstruck.

I lied -- there is an antidote -- if administered in time -- Asher’s eyes flicker past McMillan, into the small room. Foreign Minister Lee lies lifeless on the first cot. Vice President Cardoza dead on the second. Admiral Hoenig, THR BRUTALLY CUT, lies on the third. MCMILLAN (horrified, helpless) -- I thought -- Nate was killed because he refused -- McMillan is hauled away, through the bunker door. Asher stares in stunned disbelief. The last of the hostages are herded out. Asher, Connor, Kang, and Lim remain in the bunker.  93. Kang hands Lim his stainless steel briefcase.
I’1ll see you shortly. Lim nods, heads for the door.
(to Kang) Please -- let my son go -- The massive bunker door CLANGS shut behind Lim, locking. Kang turns to Asher.
We’re not finished yet.
The hostages and captors file into the emergency elevator Lim thumbs the button, and the lift rises.
Kang stands before the control console, rapidly flips switches.

Initiation sequence activated. Please enter Cerberus codes. Kang enters the three codes. Upon entering the final one, the entire console WHIRS ALIVE. COMPUTER VOICE (cont’d) Cerberus is activated -- Cerberus is activated -- Asher looks on helplessly.
The North American Aerospace Defense (NORAD) command bunk
The computer mainframe LIGHTS UP like a Christmas tree. T head TECHNICIAN spins.
Get the watch commander!
Banning bursts from the stairwell, chest heaving. Spins a races down the hall.
Twin rotors throbbing, MARINE ONE -- a V-22 Osprey tiltro arrows toward the White House.
Banning moves silently down the ground floor hall. Glance behind him, Pak nowhere in sight.

At the far end of the hall, the elevator doors OPEN. The hostages and their captors rush from the car. Banning pulls back, eyes watchful. More commandos race up join those exiting the car. Some sort of rally point. Banning watches, unseen. Eyes searching for Asher and Connor.

The commandos unsling their shoulder bags, unzipping them What looks like folded BLACK CLOTHING lays within. Lim reaches inside the elevator, punches a button on the control panel. The empty car DESCENDS. The commandos and hostages disappear around the corner.  95.
The massive PEOC wallscreen configures into a huge digita map of the CONTINENTAL UNITED STATES.
What’re you doing -- ? Kang flicks a switch. A dozen signal lights WINK ON acros the map. Nebraska, Colorado, South Dakota, upstate New Yo The entire NORAD missile defense grid.
ASHER (cont’d) -- we haven’t launched any missiles for you to self-destruct --
Who said anything about waiting for their launch? (pause) I’m going to trigger them inside their silos. Asher’s face drains.
(shocked) What the hell are you talking about?! But that means -- Kang smiles. ASHER (cont’d) (pleading) Listen, you wanted a unified Korea -- you're going to get it -- you don’t need to do this --

A unified Korea? (laughs) I’ve listened to that empty socialist palaver my entire life. Asher is stunned to his core. KANG (cont’d) No, Mr. President. That’s not why I’m here.  96. Kang turns, and kneels down before Connor. Stares directl into the boy’s eyes. KANG (cont’d) You know Connor, I watched my mother die too. Want to know how? (pause) The American mine... was hidden in the snow. It exploded -- I couldn’t hear a thing. Just this high-pitched buzz in my ears. I looked down and... I was covered with blood. My mother... her face was gone. Legs bloody stumps. Yet still -- she reached out for me -- as she bled out in the snow...

Get away from him! Kang slowly rises. Turns to Asher, face a cold mask. KANG (matter-of- fact) The explosive force within each hardened bunker will detonate the warheads. Two hundred kilotons per missile, nominal yield. Tens of millions will perish in the resultant nuclear winter... your farm belt decimated for the next 250 years. A cold... dark... radioactive wasteland. Kang turns to the control console and flips the “ENABLE” switch. KANG (cont’d) Now too, America shall know famine and destruction. The console timer reads 8:00.00 and begins counting down. Eight minutes to Doomsday.
Marine One flares for a landing, twin rotors whirring.  97.
COUNTER SNIPER MARKSMEN peer through Starlight nightscope Zeroing the South Portico.
Hercules Six, in position. POV NIGHTSCOPE: The South Portico square in the sniper’s crosshairs. When the commandos step outside, they’re dead men.
Through a small window, Banning watches Marine One land o the South Lawn. From beneath the South Portico, the hostages and their captors slowly emerge onto the South Lawn...
in black ski masks and rain ponchos. The indistinguishabl huddled group shuffles for Marine One.
The sharpshooters squint through their sniper scopes.
Hercules Six, do you have a shot?
Negative. Targets unclear.
Banning watches the huddled group shuffle for the tiltrot Mind racing. He raises his MP-5 and SMASHES the window pane. Triggers LONG BURST across the lawn.

Banning’s line of slugs CHURN the grass.  98. It works. On instinct, the commandos REACT. Draw their weapons, searching for targets. The hostages duck like sheep. Now we know who the commandos are. The rooftop snipers OPEN FIRE. The commandos are mowed do like a scythe. The hostages race for Marine One. Banning’s eyes frantica scan the fast-moving figures... No one the size of Connor. Where is he? Where’s the President? McMillan and the other hostages dive aboard the tiltrotor Cowering against the whizzing bullets. Lim leaps aboard, clutching Kang’s briefcase.
I’m taking hits! Wheels up! Marine One takes off, turbines howling.
Kang stands watching on the video monitor. VIDEO SCREEN: Marine One lifts off from the South Lawn. Kang pulls out a small TRIGGER DEVICE.
No! Kang thumbs the button.
Marine One EXPLODES over the South Lawn. Disintegrating i MASSIVE FIREBALL.  99.
Banning stares in horror.
The LIVE NEWSFEED unfolds on the wallscreen. The gathered watch in disbelief as the tiltrotor DISSOLVES IN FLAMES.
Kang gazes at the monitor screen, pleased.
Banning spins, races down the corridor.
Kang presses a button on the control console and
opens in the bunker floor. Kang turns to Asher and Connor, huddled against the wall.

Get up. Asher glares up in defiance. Kang reaches down and roughl hauls the President to his feet. Shoves him forward. Behind Kang, unseen, Connor’s eyes dart over the mainfram He reaches out, quickly hits a button. Asher and Connor share the briefest look. Kang spins, eyes narrowed. Grabs the boy, and pushes him his father down the metal stairway at gunpoint. And on the blinking control console behind them, the butt which Connor pressed is now illuminated. It reads... BUNKER UNSEALED.  100.

CLOSE ON WALLSCREEN: Everyone stares in stunned silence a the burning wreckage that was Marine One. No one could have survived. Trumbull’s eyes move down the wallscreen -- to the LIVE M FEEDS of the escalating Korean crisis. VIDEO FOOTAGE: North Korean tanks and artillery rumble al the DMZ. Jet fighters zoom overhead.
They’ re going to do it --
Sir -- the President’s dead! Order the Fleet back! Across the room, Malik stands, hotline phone pressed to h ear.
Jesus Christ -- Everyone spins. MALIK (cont’d) (looks up) Cerberus has been activated. Trumbull’s face blanches.
What? But we haven’t launched a counterstrike -- A terrible beat. The realization of Kang’s true diabolica plan becomes clear.
How many silos? Mailk puts the receiver down, face ashen.
All of them. They exchange looks, faces frozen in utter horror.  101.
Banning races up. Retrieves O’Neil’s tac-com and the weap which he previously left in the hall.
(into tac-com) Director Jacobs --
Banning’s voice comes over the intercom.
Banning!
I don’t think the President and Connor were on Marine One. They may still be alive -- The room BUZZES with the revelation.
(talking fast) Listen, Cerberus has been activated! Kang’s going to detonate the ICBMs in their silos -- BANNING (stunned disbelief) What!

He’s going to kill us all. Banning is rocked. JACOBS (cont’d) You have to get in that bunker. It’s the only way to stop it -- Banning spins, mind racing. The emergency elevator. He sprints down the corridor.  102.

Kang leads Asher and Connor below to the platform for the Subterranean Launch Evac Device (S.L.E.D.). An undergroun escape car, shaped like a small bullet train. A tracked tunnel leads into the darkness.
Banning pries at the heavy emergency elevator doors. They won’t budge. He tries again, teeth clenched. Pulls with all his might. Slowly, the doors part.
ARMY RANGERS storm across the lawn of the White House.

Doors open, Banning unbuckles his belt. Rigs a crude harn and straps it onto the elevator cables. JACOBS’ VOICE (0O.S.) (over tac-com) There’s not much time -- Banning looks into the black shaft. It’s a long way down. He takes a deep breath... and steps into space.
The countdown monitor on the control console runs down. 2 minutes, 36 seconds remain.  103.
The Army Rangers burst into the White House. Re-secure th building.
Banning lunges around the corner. Races down the corridor for the PEOC when

strides into the corridor from the far end. In one smooth motion, Pak levels his weapon and unloads o FULL AUTOMATIC. A withering burst of fire. Banning is DRIVEN BACK, around the corner. He reaches his MP-5 around the corner, SPRAYS blindly down the hall. Pak keeps advancing, furiously FIRING. Banning pulls the trigger. CLICK! Empty. Pak keeps advancing, FURIOUS RATE OF FIRE never slowing. Banning scrambles away, loses his tac-com. Pak turns the corner, BLASTS the headset to pieces. Banning is trapped. He’s a dead man. Pak raises his weapon for the killing burst -- Click. He’s dry too! Pak tosses the weapon. Pulls his COMBAT KNIFE. The thing looks like a fucking sword. Frantic, Banning gropes in his pants pocket. Pak advances down the hall -- frighteningly fast for a ma his size. He raises the knife and
magically appears between his eyes. Pak sways unsteady, face confused. Then topples forward l a totem, dead.  104.
The countdown monitor continues its inexorable march. 48 seconds to go.

Banning rushes up to the massive door to the PEOC bunker. Like the portal to the Underworld itself. The vault-like door is shut tight. Against all hope, Banning’s hand reaches for the door han He presses down on the latch. The door opens.
Kang, Asher, and Connor get strapped into the evac car.

Banning races inside. Lunges for the control console. 34 seconds remain. His eyes frantically search the myriad lights and switche He spies the button: “NATIONAL MILITARY COMMAND CENTER”. Banning punches it.
Banning’s SWEATY FACE appears on the wallscreen.
How do I stop it?
Find the control panel marked -- “COUNTERMAND” .  105. Banning’s eyes fly over the dials and toggles. 19 seconds left.
Got it!
Flip the blue-white switch marked “INITIATE RECALL”. Banning flips the switch.
Deactivation sequence initiated. Please enter abort command. The 16-character “ENTER CODE” field illuminates. 15 seconds remain.
(urgent) Give it to me --

(enunciating precisely) November-India-Lima-5- Sweat runs into Banning’s eyes. He blinks it away. 10... 9... 8... JACOBS (cont’d) Oscar-Hotel-backslash-niner- His fingers fly. Tie. 6... 5.0. JACOBS (cont’d) Victor-Kilo-underscore-hashtag- Banning doesn’t even breathe. 4... 3... 2... JACOBS (cont’d) Echo-7-Sierra-Foxtrot- The timers hits 00:00:00.  106.
Cerberus has been deactivated. Cerberus has been deactivated. Banning’s eyes flick to the open stairwell in the floor. Without hesitation, he races across the bunker. Vaults do the stairs.

Kang initializes the launch sequence. Turns to Asher and draws his tanto (tactical Special Forces knife). Asher’s eyes go wide. The blade FLASHES DOWN -- -- and CUTS Asher’s zipcuffs. Kang presses the President’ palm to the translucent ID SQUARE on the car’s control pa
Welcome, Mr. President. The SLED’s engines ROAR TO LIFE. Banning races across the launch platform. Sprints after t escape car and
onto the rear of the SLED. Just as the escape car ROCKETS down the track. The SLED accelerates shockingly fast. SLAMS down the rail
Trumbull scoops up the flashing hotline phone.
NORAD confirms. Cerberus has been shut down. Everyone can breathe again.
The escape car SCREAMS forward, tracks a blur. Somehow, Banning holds on.  107. He ducks his head into the slipstream. And sees --
Up ahead, nothing but a wall of SOLID EARTH. The car SLAMS FORWARD at 80 MPH. Banning ducks down, suck air in short, rapid breaths.

Through the windscreen, the earthen wall rushes up. No ti to stop. Asher glares at Kang. Kang stares back, face impassive. He’s daring him. The black wall LOOMS like death itself. Asher glances one last time at Connor and then --
AND PRESSES his palm to the control panel ID square. The earthen wall EXPLODES.

Explosive bolts DETONATE, whole wall DISINTEGRATING into nothingness. The SLED rockets through the swirling debris, into the de of the Tidal Basin. An AVALANCHE OF WATER engulfs Banning The SLED zips underwater like a streaking torpedo. A homing beacon suddenly begins to DRONE. The SLED slowly rises, Banning holding on. The escape car continues to ascend. Banning’s face contor Been down too long. Need air. His torso writhes, burning lungs screaming... Banning lets go. He floats away, body disappearing into t murky depths.  108. The SLED keeps rising.

The escape car surfaces, docking at an underground sewer substation. The main hatch OPENS. Kang prods Asher and Connor from the car with his gun. On the docking platform. Without warning -- Kang spins -- PISTOL WHIPS Asher acros the face. The President drops to his knees.
Dad! Kang looms over Asher.
Goodbye, Mr. President -- Without ceremony, Kang points the pistol in Asher’s face

SUDDENLY DIVES from the shadows -- TACKLING KANG to the ground. The pistol spins from Kang’s hand, across the ste platform. Kang spins away. The two men face each other, circling. Kang draws his tanto. Cat-quick -- Kang leaps forward -- razor-sharp blade flas A Ninjutsu master. The blade SLICES Banning’s arm. Asher grabs the FLARE GUN from the SLED. Aims at the two spinning, circling forms. No clear shot.

(yells to Asher) Run! Asher hesitates. BANNING (cont'd) -- take Connor -- go! Asher grabs Connor’s hand. They race for the ladder.  109. Kang LUNGES -- and Banning grabs his knife hand. They SMA into the wall -- furiously grappling. Kang DRIVES a fist into Banning’s kidney. Banning grunts, nearly fainting. Kang leaps back. Connects with a SPIN KICK to Banning’s head. Banning FALLS. Kang LEAPS onto Banning, straddling him. Banning BLOCKS Kang’s fatal knife thrust -- but the blade bears down -- directly over Banning’s heart -- The two lock in a DEATH EMBRACE, but Kang has the advanta He BEARS DOWN harder. Banning struggles beneath him. Slowly -- inexorably -- the blade ARCS DOWN. The tip PIER Banning’s skin, drawing blood... When from the wall above, a telltale HISS. With the last of his strength, Banning pushes Kang’s face Directly in line with the recessed venting pipe --

EXPLODES from the wall. The force of the BLAST blows Kang off Banning. The tanto goes spinning into the water. Kang staggers back, grimaci with rage and pain. He scrambles for his pistol across th platform. Banning LEAPS up, races for the substation ladder. Kang GRABS the pistol, whirls. FIRES wildly after Banning Banning climbs the ladder, bullets WHINING.

An isolated, cordoned area on the banks of the Tidal Basi Yellow caution tape flutters. Asher and Connor climb from the access manhole. Banning scrambles from the manhole after them. Runs to th President and Connor, prods them forward.
Come on! Connor looks back. And SCREAMS.  110. Banning whirls and
climbs from the manhole. He shambles forward, eyes burnin Like some demonic specter from Hell. Kang turns, and we see...

head_text.subj: THE LEFT SIDE OF HIS FACE

text: is blistered BLACK. Ear, skin, hair, all gone. Asher raises the flare gun. Kang levels his own pistol at Connor.

(to Asher) Don’t be stupid -- Asher lowers the flare. Drops it in the grass. Banning’s eyes glance to the weapon. He just might make it. Banning stops himself. Looks from Asher to Kang. Kang crosses the recently-erected fireworks platform, mov in for the kill. KANG (cont’d) Annyong-hi kaseyo, Mr. President -- Kang levels his weapon at Asher.
No! Kang pulls the trigger. Banning dives in front of Asher -
Saving the President’s life. And giving Asher one crucial second. To grab the flare gun from the grass. Asher swings the weapon up, aiming wildly...  111.

The flare misses. The projectile falls short, SIZZLING at Kang’s feet. Kang looks up. And with that horrific ghastly face... he smiles. A look pure evil. Kang raises his weapon to kill the President. When somewhere, in the dark recesses of his diabolical br something suddenly clicks. Kang’s eyes flicker for the briefest second --

The whole fireworks platform upon which Kang stands liter ERUPTS. Detonating in a GIGANTIC FIREBALL. Kang just isn’t there anymore. The soaring fireworks rocket skyward, BOOMING. Vaporizing Kang into a million pieces. Asher helps Banning to his feet. Checks his wound.

You okay? Banning nods, wincing. The two share a long look. A whirlwind of emotions pass between them. ASHER (cont’d) Thank you -- Asher pulls his son close, grateful. Banning’s eyes fill with sweet redemption.
Over here! Army Rangers converge on Banning and the President from across the Mall.  112.

On the wallscreen, LIVE MEDIA COVERAGE of the continuing Korean crisis. Banner headlines read: “WAR APPEARS IMMINE VIDEO FOOTAGE: Massed TANKS AND ARTILLERY prepare to roll across the border. MOTORIZED INFANTRY itching to attack. The gathered all stare at the wallscreen, faces filled wi apprehension, when...
suddenly bursts into the room, flanked by Banning and Con Everyone leaps to their feet, astounded. The President is alive!
Mr. President, thank God!

Get Pyongyang on the line -- now. Everyone waits, expectant. The wallscreen flickers. The NORTH KOREAN PREMIER appears on the screen. Asher straightens. And for the first time since this whol nightmare began, he resumes his role as President and Commander-in-Chief. ASHER (cont'd) Mr. Premier, this is President Benjamin Asher. I hereby demand the immediate withdrawal of all combat divisions deployed along the DMZ in their current posture of imminent aggression -- The Premier stares back, face unreadable. ASHER (cont'd) If you do not accede to this request, you leave me no choice, in accordance with America’s mutual defense pact with the Republic of Korea, to act against you at once with the full might and fury of the United States arsenal --  113.
Mr. President. I assure you our military forces are merely engaged in war game exercise. This is our sovereign right -- Asher’s voice hardens.
And this is my final request, Mr. Premier. I want your word you will stand down. (beat) Do I have it?
The Democratic Peoples Republic of Korea is a peaceable nation, Mr. President.
(firm) Do I have your word? A long, excruciating beat.

You have it. The Premier’s face disappears from the screen. The entire Crisis Room EXPLODES in cheers and applause. Asher’s gaze flicks across the room -- and finds Malik. T two men share a LONG, PROFOUND LOOK. Malik blinks first, looks away. Jacobs slowly approaches Asher.
Mr. President -- She struggles for the words. JACOBS (cont’d) On behalf of the Secret Service... I want you to know, sir.. (faltering) I’m sorry.  114. Jacobs looks down. Nothing more to say.
No need to apologize, Director. Asher glances at Banning. ASHER (cont’d) You had your best man on it.

Dramatically backlit by searchlights, Army Rangers hoist American flag over the White House once again. The Stars and Stripes ripple in the breeze. The flag raising on Iwo Jima has nothing on this one.
Dignitaries and press assemble on the beautifully restore South Lawn.
President Asher addresses the nation from his podium.

America has withstood many tests in her time. None more trying than this most recent adversity. But together as a nation -- and through the unflagging efforts of a courageous few -- America has once again proven that if we stand together -- that if we stand as one -- we shall always prevail. The gathered all rise in THUNDEROUS APPLAUSE. Connor beam proudly up at his father. Then he turns. And if the boy can beam even more proudly, does.  115. For standing behind them, in the unmistakable shades and coiled earpiece of the United States Secret Service Presidential Protection detail, is... MIKE BANNING. FADE TO BLACK.
